title: What are the claims of metaphysics? - Quora

response.answer_text: In contemporary use, the term “metaphysics” is generally applied to that large body of things we might lump under “New Age” ideas, or even “paranormal” ideas. Things like notions of “higher planes of existence” and “transcendentalism” and whatever you care to lump in there. This is not the same as the more classical ideas of the term. My favorite definition of the term is as follows: “Metaphysics is like a man without a lantern, descending into a dark basement to look for a black cat…That isn’t there.”

Metaphysics is a field of inquiry. It concerns questions about the basic nature of reality. It doesn’t have claims. People make claims concerning metaphysics. So, one might ask how Aristotle’s metaphysics differ from Plato’s.
